website_summaries.verdict: With its big, bold screen, water-resistant design and rock-bottom price, the Moto G4 is a dazzling deal.
pros: The Moto G4's big, bold screen and junk-free software make it a pleasure to use throughout the day
Its ability to survive a dunking will appeal to the clumsy among us
cons: Processor performance is great for everyday tasks, but gamers will want to shop elsewhere

website_summaries.verdict: Motorola's Moto G4 is a relatively affordable midrange phone with a mix of capable hardware and broad support for all major carriers. It's a good option for budget buyers.

customer_reviews.title: Not all it's cracked up to be!
customer_reviews.text: Very reasonable phone for the money and was very happy at first. But only 12 MONTHS later, the battery is rubbish (will drain after 2-3hrs browsing/emailing/messaging on net) and i'm constantly emptying the cache, recycling apps on what I had presumed was a big enough memory size (16gb) for a medium user as myself. My previous Motorola with less memory lasted almost 3 years. Now I'm looking at other brands for my next phone. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: Tina T-bag

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Bought this as a replacement for a very ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Bought this as a replacement for a very old Motorola that was permanently glued to me ear when I was working. Now, I don't "live" on the phone but when I do use it, it is a pleasure to use. Had it a wee while now and it is still working as new. Batteries last a reasonable amount of time which is a relief as some electronic products that I have are useless in this respect.
customer_reviews.author: M79

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic phone
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is truly brilliant. There are many professional reviews online so I won't go through every aspect of the phone. The only things I will say: - General OS Performance + Multitasking is very good on the 16GB/2GB version. - When you press the screen/edge of the phone, the back cover pops back into place with an annoying noise. The cover becomes slightly lose in places again very quickly. For me, the Plus wasn't worth it as I don't take many pictures and a fingerprint sensor would be nice but not nice enough to justify the price bump (plus the fingerprint sensor spoils the look of the front of the phone slightly in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence Dhonau

customer_reviews.title: Seemed great value. AT FIRST. But then...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks the phone developed a "ghost touch" problem which made it pretty much unusable. This was resolved after 3 returns to a warranty repair site by replacing the screen. The new screen has major "burn in" issues where if any image remains on screen for more than a few minutes that image overlays everything afterwards for up to an hour. This will be my last moto.
customer_reviews.author: M. FINNEGAN

customer_reviews.title: Fails much too early in its working life
customer_reviews.text: My Motorola G4 would've got a 5* review if it hadn't failed catastrophically while I was out travelling in Asia. It wouldn't hold a charge and suddenly got worse within a week. Bought a new battery & charge lead at a cost of £45 (didn't have internet access without my phone to get anything cheaper). That didn't work, so once back in the UK I had the charging port replaced & a solder point rejoined on the circuit for £45. It lasted less than a week again. I had the phone less than two years before the planned obsolescence rendered it useless. SHAME ON YOU MOTOROLA.
customer_reviews.author: Sue H

customer_reviews.title: One of the best budget & open source phones!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this smartphone for more that 2 years (and it's still working perfectly) and I am more that happy with it. Great battery life, fast processor, decent camera, nice UI without much crapware preinstalled. The only thing I noticed after owning the phone for 2 years is that it's started showing signs of pixel ghosting, which is a sign for pixels dying out it's only natural for such long use...
customer_reviews.author: illy

customer_reviews.title: Having bought a smart phone a couple of years ago and then giving ...
customer_reviews.text: Having bought a smart phone a couple of years ago and then giving it to charity because it was too complicated I was wary of trying another, but, and I rarely write reviews, this phone is fantastic! It's logical, easy to use, nice touch with the torch, camera is good, battery life for me is over four days. Only downside is if you want it quickly and it is turned off it is slowish to switch on, but I have no problem with that. VERY Happy!
customer_reviews.author: Sally V  North

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for purpose - avoid
customer_reviews.text: In many respects this is a brilliant phone. It's fast, with a great screen, and I love the camera. For the price the spec is truly excellent. BUT, I have been plagued with the much-documented ghost-touching, which has got so bad that now, seven months after purchase, I am switching back to Samsung. It isn't fit for purpose. Nothing I have read online has convinced me that this is a) a one-off or b) resolvable, so it's goodbye to Moto from me.
customer_reviews.author: Marthur Lee

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need in a phone!
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought iPhone 6s plus off eBay. I didn't get on with it. Far too heavy and difficult to handle. Also after upgrading to iOS 10 I was left with 2 GB and no option to increase storage. I had the original moto x years ago and thought if I was going back to android I would get as pure a version as possible. The only 'bloatware' from Motorola is actually very useful- gesture and voice control. Placed in a good black leather wallet this phone is a proper workhorse for a fraction of the iPhone plus. You will know the specs. If you are reading this. All I can say is that change can be good!
customer_reviews.author: Adam247

customer_reviews.title: A phone to last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone in 2017 and I still use it. It is definitely durable and lightweight, with a large screen. Of course I use a case and glass screen on top to make sure nothing breaks/cracks. The main con of this phone is its battery life. I barely lasted 12 hours with average use.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone, awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous phone for a fabulous price. I recently upgraded from a Iphone 5C and didn't want to be hampered down by a long expensive contract that I could not get out of. So I decided, after much research, to buy a handset on a budget and then go with giffgaff on a monthly rolling sim. For the price, the phone is outstanding, it may not compete with the high end models but it runs like a breeze and handles all of my apps brilliantly without a hitch. Overall, a fantastic phone for a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Peteb

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone in April 2017 and after 10 months it is practically unusable due to "ghost touch". After reading other reviews and tech sites it seems there's no magic fix for this problem and there is no option in "my orders" to return for a refund. Very disappointing, please avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Not value for money
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this phone and found it very easy to set up and use. The only problem was the softwears corrupted one week after the guarantee ran out. I went on line and found that the problems I had with the phones softwear was similar to that experienced by other users. I would have given this phone 4 to 5 stars had it lasted for a couple of years but it doesn't represent value for money after lasting for only one year.
customer_reviews.author: Spud

customer_reviews.title: Not as stated.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered my second 'As New' Motorola G4. The first one came blemish free in a box with a hole punched in it, not a problem and happy with the phone. This one I bought for the wife as she was impressed by mine. However this time the box was unblemished, 'As New' however the phone has a tiny scratch in the middle of the screen, not 'As New' in my wife's opinion. Not in mine either, so it looks like it may be going back. What a pity.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone but big battery and other issues
customer_reviews.text: Please don't buy this phone! This isn't reverse psychology - it's just a bad buy! The phone itsel is a great size, good to hold and use but after only a couple of months the battery capacity is awful and big unsolvable issues of random turning off. Motorola are good at suggesting self fixes but take no responsibility for actually resolving the problem - check a number of forums to hear from others who've had the same issues with moto G 4. Buy a different phone, I did!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy e

customer_reviews.title: Great phone but become too buggy
customer_reviews.text: This phone lasted me a good couple of years before it started bugging out of control. It lagged a little when i first purchased it but it became completely unusable by the end if it's course. Don't know if it was a manufacturer error because other than that it was great. A very great affordable phone if you don't have the buggy issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unless you like wasting 300 pounds or more
customer_reviews.text: Unless you like wasting 300 pounds or more, buy this. I have been smugly having no problems witha phone that works fine for all apps for 18 months at a cost of 160 quid.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Trees

customer_reviews.title: Good but check tech news

customer_reviews.title: Finally broke down and bought a smart phone but didn't want to spend a fortune and ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally broke down and bought a smart phone but didn't want to spend a fortune and didn't want too many bells and whistles. Very impressed with this phone so far. The phone is a nice size, the on screen keyboard a good size and easy to use. The rear camera takes lovely pictures. The battery doesn't last as long as my old phone but that's understandable considering the screen and processors.
customer_reviews.author: C. A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I have an iPhone 6 plus for work and with the exception of the fingerprint recognition I'm struggling to see what the iPhone does that this doesn't. I'm sure there are things on the iPhone that I just don't know about, or something in the electronics that justifies it being around 4 times the price of this, but in terms of function, memory and apps available, I can't fault the G4. My missus uses a Samsung and I find that a bit clunky and not intuitive, but this one I really have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Generally excellent for the money and would have been 5 stars ...
customer_reviews.text: Generally excellent for the money and would have been 5 stars had Motorola included a gyroscope (compass). Without it the route navigation does not re-centre the direction of travel arrow to the vertical. OK a minor point all in all, but still a little frustrating.

So much better then the previous mobiles he has owned. The phone is very easy to use! We are both very very happy with this purchase!

customer_reviews.author: RichP

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction of my Motorolla

customer_reviews.author: Theo Micha

customer_reviews.title: ghost touch behavior

customer_reviews.title: Generally a brilliant phone. Fast

Why only four stars: the camera is generally pretty bad. Pictures are automatically stored by Google iphotos which sorts them or something meaning I can't find some of my photos, or upload anything but my 40 most recent photos to Instagram. Screenshotting also does not always work and camera auto settings have ISO too high making pictures grainy. This IS outweighed by all the other brilliant details of the phone however.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for cheap price

It also has 2GB of ram which more than enough for every day tasks and 16gb of storage which u can expand with an sd card I mainly store photos and music so its more than enough for me.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value.  If you don't HAVE to have a half eaten apple on your phone, this one is a worthy contender

customer_reviews.title: Worth it's price

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this phone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value

customer_reviews.title: Good Android phone.

customer_reviews.author: Adrian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 'budget' phone

But that's a small price to pay for such a great device with a fabulous screen and plenty of power under the hood.

customer_reviews.title: Stop thinking, just buy the thing.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the G5

Feels like a very similar experience to far more expensive Nexus phones.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it

customer_reviews.title: Really good..mostly

For that charge time it does last quite long but if you don't charge it overnight you probably won't have a phone the next day. 6 hours is unusual. It is usually 4-5hours for a full charge. Though this is shorter it is still quite a nuisance.

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended, failed after 18 months.

OK if you replace your phone every year, but if so there are better deals to be had on contract. Not recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend if you're looking for something below top of the ...
